website_summaries.verdict: A handle-free ceramic neti pot that is easy to hold, use, and clean. An essential tool for fighting sinus congestion.
pros: Pot is easy to grip, even when slippery and wet
Does away with the hollow plastic handle that may trap germs on other models
cons: At less than 8 oz., some users found the capacity too small, while others noted the spout was too large and caused spills

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, High-Quality Neti Pot
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful craftsmanship and ease-of-use make this a perfect design. Not that having a decorative, pretty neti pot is something everyone requires, but it is rather nice to have something that is appealing; especially if you are under the weather when you're using it. There is an indented spot on each side to make handling this neti pot a trouble-free experience. It is not only easy to use, but also easy to clean. The ceramic is also durable. So, unless you have an unfortunately clumsy moment, it will definitely outlast other neti pots.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible spout angle.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nicely made neti pot, for sure, which makes it so much more disappointing that the design forces me to turn my head like I'm about to shoot pea soup on a priest, but sideways. I get having to turn my head to do a gravity-neti wash, but the downturned spout forces me to have to turn even more, otherwise the nozzle presses against the septum and stops the flow. It's completely ridiculous. It's a serious shame, because the quality of the finish is superb, it's a pleasure to hold, etc.. It's a polished turd, though.
